intro: Thelypteris zeylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon shield fern, is a species of fern native to Southeast Asia and parts of the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Thelypteris zeylanica plays an important ecological role in its native habitats by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for various small organisms.
